intro: Sloanea assamica, commonly known as the Assam sloanea, is a deciduous tree native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. Its bark is thick and fissured, and it produces fleshy, orange-colored fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
